TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IPAddressInformation extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about a network interface address.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You do not create instances of this class; instances are returned by methods in the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties> class.
## Examples The following code example displays the Domain Name Service (DNS) addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#42](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#42)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#42](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#42)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#42](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#42)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPAddressInformation>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Address As IPAddress
public: abstract property System::Net::IPAddress ^ Address { System::Net::IPAddress ^ get(); };

Docs.value: An instance that contains the IP address of an interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IP address uniquely identifies the interface on the network.
## Examples The following code example displays the multicast addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#44](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#44)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#44](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#44)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#44](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#44)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsDnsEligible As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsDnsEligible { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Internet Protocol (IP) address is valid to appear in a Domain Name System (DNS) server database.
Docs.value: if the address can appear in a DNS database; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Addresses in the range 169.254.0.0 to 169.254.255.255 are not DNS eligible. These addresses are reserved for Automatic Private IP Addressing (APIPA).
## Examples The following code example displays the anycast addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#43](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#43)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#43](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#43)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#43](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#43)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsTransient As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsTransient { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Internet Protocol (IP) address is transient (a cluster address).
Docs.value: if the address is transient; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A transient address is assigned to a cluster and should not be used by most applications.
